review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2021
name: Ohio_Gamer
title: Will not set even after 3 tries.
review: To start with I'm using a Mueller yogurt maker to take the guess work out of this. I bought the 5 pack and immediately tried making a batch using the provided instructions, 1 qt. of whole milk, boiled, cool down, temp check via temp probe, then incubation for 12 hours. What I got was a touch of curd at the bottom of one of jars I checked. Leaving it for another 4 hours did nothing.I tried a 2nd batch with whole milk but no boil and used the microwave to get the milk to temp so I could add the culture. This batch I left for 16 hours and had not set up at all, no curd, nothing.The 3rd try I boiled whole milk, cooled down, and left it to incubate for 24 hours. Nothing but milk.I may not have made yogurt a lot but I have made it a few times and have never had a total failure, let alone 3 in a row. I left the incubator to sit, didn't shake, or move it, boiled, no boil, whole milk - homogenized. I have no idea what's wrong other than maybe this item got too hot in shipping? Going with a different brand and see how that goes.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2021
name: So Cal So Cal
title: makes great tasting yogurt
review: Excellent starter as long as you followexact directions on your yogurt maker.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2021
name: Jake's mom
title: Half of my batch of yogurt did not solidify
review: I am an experienced yogurt maker and I thought I’d try this brand.Half of the batch I made last night didn’t solidify so I had to throw it out.Wasted time and money plus now I have to buy more milk and make another batch.Very disappointed.Will not use this brand again.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
name: Carlson Family
title: Very disappointing!
review: I decided to give this culture a try because I like to sample different styles of yogurt. This one ended up quite bland for my liking. On top of that, I ended up with mold on top of almost half of my jars which is something that has never happened to me before. The only thing different with this latest batch of yogurt was this new culture. Definitely won't be buying this product again and will be sticking with the Icelandic culture I've been using without fail. I was definitely disappointed in this product.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021
name: Melissa L.
title: Generation 5 and still going strong
review: I’m on generation five of this starter and it’s still going strong. We make about 5qts a week. Excellent!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021
name: Joseph McAuley
title: Must try..
review: My Albanian wife has complained about all yogurt until we tried this, she absolutely loves this stuff and so do I. She uses whole pasteurized milk and I use heavy cream as I’m slightly allergic to milk protein. Great product and lasts a long time.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
name: caterina
title: Faulty product received
review: This is the second time I ordered from this company. This time around I received a bad product. The yogurt didn’t set AT ALL.

title: Organic yogurt
review: We dont find a yogurt like in our country and we decided to make it at home so I ordered these cultures. I like it but especially mu husband likes it very much the smell is sour but delicious.

title: Absolutely the best yogurt.
review: I have been making yogurt for 25 years and this is hands down the best.Highly recommend.

title: Great
review: So delicious! Completely happy with the purchase. Although we only used one pouch so far in one month because we remake new batches every 5 days or so.

title: Repeat Buy
review: I've purchased this product numerous times to make yogurt for my daughter. She loves the taste and I love that I get a quality batch of yogurt every time, whether I'm using a fresh sachet or re-culturing.

review: I enjoyed this yogurt immensely

name: Amazon Customer
title: one starter did not work
review: one starter did not work

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
name: JARuff
title: Good yogurt
review: This is my first time trying the Balkan-style Yogurt from this brand. I have previously used the Bulgarian and the Pure Acidophilus with very good results. I had a good experience with this one as well. The directions were clear and easy to follow. I incubated the yogurt in a yogurt maker for about 12 hours- it did take a long time for the yogurt to thicken, but the directions said that would likely be the case the first time. I have not yet tried making a second batch using the first batch as starter. This first batch has a good taste. It's thick and slightly tart. I'm hoping subsequent batches using the already made yogurt as starter will result in an even tarter yogurt. I'm pleased with my purchase and with this brand/company. I look forward to trying some of their other starters. I purchased the Bifido along with the Balkan-style, but I have not tried it yet.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020
name: NB
title: You don't need these to make yogurt. There's a cheaper more sustainable way to do it
review: I didn't buy this but just want to say it's a rip off. You don't need these. You can use a spoon of yogurt or sour cream and you'll get the same effect. And once you have made your yogurt once, you can just use that yogurt as future starter.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020

title: Delicious Yogurt
review: This product was just wonderful in every way! My family loves it!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
name: Durability seeker
title: Great product. Makes creamy yogurt.
review: I have bought this product for 3-4 consecutive years with great results. It lasts 2-3 months in the fridge.Betza

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
name: G. Stone
title: Convenient
review: I make yogurt in a sous vide, so I have accurate temperature control. The original run yielded a firm textured, deliciously sour yogurt. Seeding a second run with this yogurt, and following the directions provided for second runs (only 3-6 hours of fermentation), yielded a runnier product, but still delicious.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
name: Camperling
title: Perfect Greek yogurt. First batch takes the longest
review: As noted on the satchet package, the first batch from powder takes the longest. Using whole milk, it took 18 hours. But subsequent batches made from my first batch took 6 hours. Wonderful flavor and creaminess
